messages.message:
im about to put up a pr for this to extend the height of the chat portion, but @Siya i just want to confirm that this is the experience we want. i know in the figmas, we remove the chat box altogehter, but when the error message is just a message from the instabase bot, there are a few issues:
1. the message gets blocked by the banner (see first screenshot)
2. even with the banner closed, the message isn't that visible because its in the bottom right corner of the screen, and if a user scrolls up at all, the message will be completely invisible.
given these concerns, should we maybe consider disabling the send chat button instead of removing the message input completely?
maybe wee keep the design for now since its last day before launch, but might be something to reconsider later

The goal with the current design/removing the chat was to not have the banner overlap and instead take space at the bottom - it should not hide the chat similar to how it is not hiding the upload file button. We shouldn't have the empty space in the chat either.

Disabling chat (vs. removing) does seem to work better for the case when users scroll up and don't see the last message by us. Even in that case, I don't think we should hide the UI behind the banner.
